alert.note: Alert for Lake; Newton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 02 at 12:16PM EST until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Chicago IL has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Indiana... Kankakee River at Shelby affecting Newton and Lake IN Counties. Iroquois River near Foresman affecting Newton County. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Kankakee River from Near I-65 and De Motte downstream to IL/IN state line, including the Shelby gauge. * WHEN...From Saturday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, Water overflows low-lying river banks along Bluegrass Road and in Wildwood Estates east of Sumava Resorts. At 11.5 feet, Low-lying residences are threatened along Bluegrass Road and in Wildwood Estates east of Sumava Resorts. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM CST Thursday the stage was 9.7 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached by Saturday afternoon. The river may crest near 11 feet by early next week. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means water levels above flood stage are possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Persons along rivers and streams in the watch area should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop. These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected by late tonight.
